result.execSummary:
The defendant Russell W Case was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting/Failing to Stop/Fleeing [Modifiers: Repeater], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(2t).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Case called at 2:21pm [mo]
Defendant Russell W Case in court, in custody with Attorney Elizabeth F Svehlek.  ADA Brookellen Teuber appears for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Teuber verifies victim rights compliance

Counsel verifies receipt of Competency Report
Counsel and Mr. Case waive there right to present other evidence
Mr. Case believes that he is competent
The State believes Mr. Case to be competent
The Court accepts the report of Dr. Phelps; the Court finds Mr. Case competent

The Court discharges Mr. Case from the previous commitment order; the proceedings resume

Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; plea of " No Contest " entered on Count #1; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; the Court accepts plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State, the Court reads in and dismisses: Count #2
Sentencing arguments given by Counsel

The Court sentences Defendant to:
--serve 321 days in Jefferson County Jail
--321 days credit
--pay costs of $243  plus $200 DNA surcharge= $443, to be paid in $30 per month installments commencing on 3/21/16 and on the 21st day of each month thereafter until paid in full; non-payment shall result in a   8 day jail term with Huber privileges, consecutive
recess: 2:55pm
Proposed order to produce
Competency hearing at 01-21-2016 02:00 pm
Filed by DHS
Faxed copy of report-report received in the mail was processed and distributed
Order of Commitment for Treatment (Incompetency)

Case called at 11:54am [mo]
[Scheduled for Competency Hearing]
Defendant Russell W Case in court, in custody with Attorney Elizabeth F. Svehlek.   ADA Theresa Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin.

Both counsel, and also Mr. Case individually, waive their right to present further evidence on the issue of Competency.
ADA Beck agrees with the evaluator's conclusion that Mr. Case is not competent to understand the court proceedings at this time.
Mr. Case remains that he is competent.

The Court finds that the examiners report establishes by clear and convincing evidence that Mr. Case is NOT competent; gives reasoning.
The Court finds that it is likely that Mr. Case will become competent within the time period if proper treatment is provided.  
The Court finds that it is proper to commit Mr. Case, the Court does commit Mr. Case for treatment.
The Court orders the Commitment will be at an inpatient facility determined by DHS.
The Court finds that treatment and medication is necessary to restore Mr. Case's competency
The Court orders that medication and treatment be administered on an involuntary basis.
The Court directs the Clerk to prepare the proper order

The Court directs that it will not be setting a hearing today; but to flag this case in less than 90 days to watch for the filing of the report and then scheduling of a hearing.

Court signs the Order of Commitment for Treatment.
Recess: 12:13pm 

NEXT: JA set Reminder out Approximately 90 days to Review this case and Schedule Hearing

records.descr: DE not competent to stand trial, case suspended

records.addlTxt: Order of Commitment for Treatment

Case called at 10:15am [mo]
Defendant Russell W Case in court with Attorney Elizabeth F. Svehlek.  ADA Monica Hall  appears for the State of Wisconsin.

ADA Hall verifies victim rights compliance

Atty. Svehlek indicates that she has received the examiners report; further she indicates that she provided a copy to Mr. Case.

ADA Hall indicates that the State remains in the posture that Mr. Case is not competent to proceed to Trial; further she indicates that Dr. Brad Smith, the examining psychologist is available by phone.

Dr. Brad Smith appears via telephone--sworn and testifies
--Direct examination by ADA Hall
--ADA Hall submits exh. #1(Competency Evaluation Report)offered & received
--Cross-Examination by Atty. Svehlek 
--Re-direct examination by ADA Hall

Mr. Case indicates that he feels he is competent
The Court finds that the State has proved by evidence that Mr. Case is not competent but that he can become/re gain competency within the statutory time period
The Court finds that it is Mr. Case's mental illness that leads him to be incapable of implying the advantages and disadvantages to accept or deny medication. 
The Court suspends court proceeds under statute

The Court orders that Mr. Case be committed to the Department of Health Services
The Court orders that Mr. Case be administered medication and/ or treatment for mental condition
The Court orders that whomever administers medication and/or treatment shall comply with appropriate medical standards.
The Court orders that the medication and/ or treatment can be done without consent of Mr. Case on an involuntary basis.
The Clerk prepares Order for Commitment for Treatment, Counsel reviews, the Court signs.
recess: 10:57am
Competency hearing at 07-20-2015 10:00 am

Case called at 3:33pm [mo]
Defendant Russell W Case in court, in custody with Attorney Elizabeth F. Svehlek.   ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Hall verifies victim rights compliance
ADA Hall orally motions for the Court to address Mr. Case's refusal to take medications as prescribed to maintain competency
ADA informs the Court that the jail staff indicates that Mr. Case is not taking required medications as ordered by the Court at competency hearing
Atty. Svehlek shares Mr. Case's understanding of medication regimen and cites case law
The Court reiterates its former ruling that the order is for voluntary and involuntary administration of medications
The Court and Counsel review State v. Meeks case law; further Atty. Svehlek questions her ability/ willingness to give insight on Mr. Case's competency.
ADA Hall shares a concern that Mr. Case's mental competency is decompenstating.
Mr. Case shares his beliefs on his mental competency.
The Court concludes that Mr. Case's court room demeanor has not raised any competency issues
The Court has discussion with Mr. Case about his competency.
The Court finds that although Mr. Case knows relatively well the role of court personnel, he is fixated on issues that are unrelated to the court proceedings.
The Court believes there is reason to doubt Mr. Case's competence and and an examination must be conducted. 
The Court orders for an order for competency evaluation to be completed for the Court's signature 
recess: 4:16pm
Order for involuntary Medication Pursuant to WIS. STAT. 971.14(5)(d)
Status conference at 07-28-2015 09:30 am
Pre-trial conference at 07-08-2015 09:20 am

records.descr: DE competent to stand trial, suspension lifted

records.addlTxt:
[MK] case called at 2:00pm. 
Defendant Russell W Case in court, in custody, with Attorney Elizabeth F. Svehlek.  ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Counsel agree that this is a hearing under Statute 971.14(5)(b).  
Mr. Case claims to be competent.  
After a series of statements by Mr. Case, the Court concludes that, on the record made, Mr. Case has not waived his right to present other evidence regarding competency.
ADA Hall references the findings made in the examining doctor's report and indicates that the State would not be able to obtain testimony that supports incompetency.  However the examining doctor does opine that Mr. Case does need to maintain medications in order to retain competency, so therefore the State is asking a continuing medication order under Statute 971(5)(d).
The Defense has no objection to the State's request for a medication order .
The Court finds Mr. Case to be competent to proceed to trial.  The Court grants the State's request for continued administration of medication and treatment in order to maintain competency during the proceedings. 
recess 2:17pm. 

NEXT:  (1) counsel are to submit a proposed order for continued administration of medication and treatment  (2) schedule case for Pretrial Conference and Status Conference

records.descr: DE not competent to stand trial, case suspended

records.addlTxt: Order of Commitment for Treatment

Case called at 1:32 [mo]
Defendant Russell W Case appear via video conferencing from Jefferson County Jail with Attorney Yelena Olegovna Zarwell.  Monica J. Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.
The Court finds that the video system is both sight and sound sufficient.
The Court confirms that both Defense Attorney and the State have received the Competency report.
Mr. Case does not waive his opportunity to present evidence on the issue of competency.
The defendant claims to be competent.
ADA Hall informs the Court that she has one witness to testify.
Dr. Deborah Collins---Sworn and Testifies(by telephone)
--examination by ADA Hall
--cross- examination by Attorney Zarwell

The Court denies the State the ability to move and enter Dr. Collins report, due to Dr. Collins testimony being finished

Arguments given by Atty Zarwell
The Court finds Mr. Case is currently incompetent, however if provided with appropriate medication and treatment is likely to become competent
The Court finds that Mr. Case is not competent to refuse medication, the Court orders the involuntary administration of treatment and medications.
The Court finds that Mr. Case is only likely to be restored to competency in an inpatient facility, the Court orders inpatient treatment. 
The Court orders these proceeding are suspended and Mr. Case is committed to the Dept of Health Services for up to 12 months.
Credit for days served: 8 days 
recess: 2:13pm
Competency hearing on March 13, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Competency hearing on April 7, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
Scheduling Notice

case called at 1:19pm. [Clerk MO]
Defendant Russell W Case appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, with Attorney Elizabeth Svehlek (appearing for Atty. Zarwell).  ADA Brookellen Teuber appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
On agreement of counsel, the Court finds that the videoconferencing system is sight and sound sufficient. 
ADA Teuber informs the Court of court proceeding thus far.
Counsel agrees that this case should be scheduled next for Competency Hearing.

Atty. Svehlek gives arguments as to bond. 
ADA Teuber gives arguments as to bond. 


The Court requires a $500 cash bond[NO special conditions were set]
The Court orders if Mr. Case does post cash bond, Mr. Case is required to sign an amended bond with the 4/7/15 Competency Hearing date. 
recess 1:28 pm.

Case called at 11:16am 
Attorney Yelena Olegovna Zarwell appear in court.   ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Russell W Case does NOT appear.
This Case was scheduled for Competency Hearing today.
The Court inquires with Counsel on thier reciept of the Competency Exam from Deborah Collins. 
The Counsel confirms receipt.
The Court inquires with Counsel on the current residence and custody status of Mr. Case. 
Upon telephone coversation with the Waukesha Co. jail, the Clerk informs the Court that Mr. Case was realeased on 2/25/2015 with no address given. 
The Court notes the State did attempt to procure Mr. Case by writ, but was unable to fulfill due to his release. 
On Motion of the State, the Court grants issuance of body only warrant, statewide. 
The Court tolls any time timits under the competency status due to Mr. Case's non-appearance. 
recess: 11:27am
Per Jean G., DA's office, defendant released from Waukesha County Jail
